findings.title: Timely massUpdatePools During Cake Rate Changes
findings.description: The `massUpdatePools()` function needs to be invoked timely when updating CAKE rates or pool weights to ensure fair reward distribution.

findings.title: Potential Re-Initialization Risks in init()
findings.description: In `MasterChefV2`, it initializes the protocol by depositing a dummy token into the `MasterChef V1` contract. However, there is no access control for the `init()` routine, and it could be called more than once.

findings.title: Duplicate Pool Detection And Prevention
findings.description: The `MasterChefV2` protocol does not perform necessary sanity checks to prevent a new pool with a duplicate token from being added.

findings.title: Trust Issue Of Admin Keys
findings.description: Privileged accounts (including `owner` and `boostContract`) play critical roles in governing and regulating protocol-related operations, posing a trust issue.
